titleStmt.title: Reports [134-135 AD]
titleStmt.author: Heron, son of Neilos, tax collector

msContents.summary: Reports of payments collected by the collectors of money taxes of Thedelphia; the taxes are the poll tax and "other distributed taxes" (merismoi); the payments are listed by names following the order of the taxpayers as they came and made the payments

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; on the back P.Col. V 1 verso 1a, 1b
Check markings precede the names of those who paid the poll tax, indicating that the payments were transferred to the bank ledger
The text does not represent the day-book of the collectors, but was copied from the day-book
A considerable portion of the roll is lost between the two fragments
In 24 cases the same man appears in both fragments

In 1a there are 8 cols. written probably by the same, small and practiced hand, even though the insertions are made in smaller letters; col. 1: 27 lines; col. 2: 22 lines; col. 3 21lines; col. 4: 28 lines; col. 5: 33 lines; col. 6: 32: col. 7: 32; col. 8: 32. In 1b there are scanty remains of 2 cols. plus 4 cols.: col. 3: 3 lines; col. 4: 27 lines; col. 5: 30 lines; c ol. 6: 29 lines

origin.persName: Heron, son of Akes, tax collector
